hints.label: prop-gravitational-constant
hints.title: Newton's Constant from Algorithmic Parameters
hints.content:
1811: :label: prop-gravitational-constant
1812: 
1813: Newton's gravitational constant in the Fractal Set framework is:
1814: 
1815: $$
1816: G = \frac{\ell_{\text{typ}}^d}{8\pi N T}
1817: 
1818: $$
1819: 
1820: where:
1821: - $\ell_{\text{typ}}$: Typical length scale of fitness landscape (e.g., $\text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$)
1822: - $N$: Total number of walkers
1823: - $T = \sigma^2/(2\gamma)$: Temperature (equipartition from Langevin)
1824: - $d$: Spatial dimension
1825: 
1826: **Interpretation**: Gravitational coupling is **weaker** when:
1827: - More walkers ($N$ large): Distributed mass-energy
hints.raw_directive:
1808: ### 5.3. Explicit Formula
1809: 
1810: :::{prf:proposition} Newton's Constant from Algorithmic Parameters
1811: :label: prop-gravitational-constant
1812: 
1813: Newton's gravitational constant in the Fractal Set framework is:
1814: 
1815: $$
1816: G = \frac{\ell_{\text{typ}}^d}{8\pi N T}
1817: 
1818: $$
1819: 
1820: where:
1821: - $\ell_{\text{typ}}$: Typical length scale of fitness landscape (e.g., $\text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$)
1822: - $N$: Total number of walkers
1823: - $T = \sigma^2/(2\gamma)$: Temperature (equipartition from Langevin)
1824: - $d$: Spatial dimension
1825: 
1826: **Interpretation**: Gravitational coupling is **weaker** when:
1827: - More walkers ($N$ large): Distributed mass-energy
1828: - Higher temperature ($T$ large): Thermal fluctuations resist focusing
